intro: Jacquinia eggersii, commonly known as Eggers' bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
